the_bitch_aari: Thank you for this. Came in at the right time. This is everything my mindspace was wanting to receive and this is something I was supposed to read and understand ! With everything happening around ! 💜
vamsi.1113: I didn't know how I once thought when I first saw this girl and thought, I would get her if I make the right moves, if I plan everything carefully, I didn't think I would even need luck, I mean she wasn't too beautiful, not out of my league atleast. Here don't get me wrong, I was raised like this, by the society that we are in, but I promise you guys, who are reading this so patiently, that Ill not let this or any such ideology of GETting a girl pass to my kids or friend. But good, in fact best, were those days when I had a inner conscience supporting me, encouraging me, to do anything I like anything I wanted. I wanted many things younger, but now I just feel like, I don't even deserve half the shit I have, none of the shit I aspire to be, and that I don't even now deserve any dream. But good were those days when I wished for a girl. When I had a secret crush over all those girls, the girl I saw in a bakery when I'm getting my fav chocolates, the girl I saw in a trip, and that girl I so senselessly flirted with everyday, and this girl, I saw, when she was speaking infront of thousands sharing stories, her own, may be lies, but embarrassing, so brave, I can't do that, for that matter I couldn't even speak up my love for those girls in my life, pity me, for I wished, having a crush on this girl, and for posting my feelings in a random insta comment.

sukanyajanardhanan: I love you so much, Rega! Thank you for this. For the last four months, I've not posted happy things on my main instagram account - I CREATED a finsta because the world was burning - it felt too unfair. Too many people had messaged me saying that they looked to my stories/posts for news and updates and protest-related thoughts; to process. It felt unfair, it still does, to post about a friend getting me some gajar-ka-halwa or my mother standing up for me, or about having dressed up in a pretty saree just because. But I have to. To sustain. Because this isn't new, it's just more visible. @sspublicdomain once told me that "hopelessness is a new feeling to us" and my professor then suplimented it with "yes, only to us, not to a lot of the world" and it's living with this reality that we're challenged. Thank you for writing through this and for letting me think and write through this.
